TopicTitle: [1.1.3] Pulsejet Argus As 014 / As 044 and other WWII german engines

Articles.Content: So, the Porsche 109-005 engine is actually just a really bad copy of the Jumo 004, by the Porsche company, before they gave up on designing aircraft. It was never really built, and if it was, it would looks, and perform like a Jumo 004.

So, the Porsche 109-005 engine is actually just a really bad copy of the Jumo 004, by the Porsche company, before they gave up on designing aircraft. It was never really built, and if it was, it would looks, and perform like a Jumo 004.

Noted ! It wasn't a priority, anyway !

Noted ! It wasn't a priority, anyway !

I didn't think it was, I was just gonna let you know...

The next thing I would model if I was you, was the different Sanger, and Lorin ramjets, You have the Lorin done, now the Sanger is left, as well as the other models.

I didn't think it was, I was just gonna let you know...

The next thing I would model if I was you, was the different Sanger, and Lorin ramjets, You have the Lorin done, now the Sanger is left, as well as the other models.

Pretty much what I have in mind. As the jumo is kinda the juno, it can wait a little longer

The next will be the one on the blueprints you provided. Then probably the Super Lorin.
Where did you get the markings?
I don't remember the mod's name, try ZZZ flag as the mod's folder's named that way.

I like the parts, I do have a small forum page tip, to make it more organised

You should make a single album for the parts, like the vab part discription, and then a few for the ship pictures or a spoiler for each craft that you dont have a huge album with a lot of differnd pictures, it woul also be nice if the .craft files where included

I'm working on a ramjet engine design, but I need a better cockpit to work with... making a Skoda Kauba by the way...

- - - Updated - - -

You may want to re-name your mod to something that represents all of the engines... or something to do with them like:

Last ditch effort, a collection of .... Germany's best engine and aircraft designs

Pagan_Scorpions collection of unique German jet propulsion

Or just 'Pagan_Scorpion's German Jet Workshop', because, while they were quite remarkable given that the industry was a mess, German WW2-era engine were not unique (although the pulsejets and ramjets could be considered so), nor of particularly good quality. Just a little less misleading.

Also, this might be of interest: http://www.deutsches-museum.de/en/collections/machines/power-engines/turbojet-engines/pulse-jet-engines/argus-schmidt-pulse-jet-1942/

Although it says on the page that it was built for testing purposes, it was to be installed on a few late-war cheapo jet fighters, specifically this one: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messerschmitt_P.1079

Edited November 15, 2015 by halowraith1

Or just 'Pagan_Scorpion's German Jet Workshop', because, while they were quite remarkable given that the industry was a mess, German WW2-era engine were not unique (although the pulsejets and ramjets could be considered so), nor of particularly good quality. Just a little less misleading.

Also, this might be of interest: http://www.deutsches-museum.de/en/collections/machines/power-engines/turbojet-engines/pulse-jet-engines/argus-schmidt-pulse-jet-1942/

Although it says on the page that it was built for testing purposes, it was to be installed on a few late-war cheapo jet fighters, specifically this one: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messerschmitt_P.1079

Pictures on that aircraft are quite misleading, the most conventional design looked like this: http://www.unicraft.biz/germ/me1079-13/art-1.jpg
So I have designed a really maneuverable aircraft that I need to put some ramjet/pulsejet engines that are powerful into. I will await further development.

Edited December 16, 2015 by Pagan_Scorpion

I downloaded the update, and the Sanger version 2 is a bit odd, neither ramjet should work past mach 2.7, the second variant not working past mach 2.9 at most.

 

They produce insane amounts of thrust, yes, but the pressure of the air coming into the intake would cause the flame holder to flameout, or lose it's flame, and with no gas burning, it shouldn't work past that speed.

 

However, if they had shock cones, that would solve that problem, but they do not, so that should be modified, just a little information.

Edited December 17, 2015 by He_162
